author: Staff Reporter
text:
15 cases registered for violation of model code of conduct so far

The Elections Department has launched two Information Technology based initiatives to streamline the process of lodging complaints and granting permission to political parties for various purposes, said Chief Electoral Officer V. Candavelou here on Wednesday.

Talking to reporters, he said that ‘Samadhan’ is a public grievance redressal system conceptualised as a comprehensive system with multiple modes for receiving complaints online, through SMS, email, mobile, fax and post. ‘Suvidha’ is a single window system for candidates and political parties to apply for various permissions.

Mr. Candavelou said that as many as 15 cases had been registered for violation of model code of conduct so far. The flying squads had so far seized Rs.20 lakh in cash and handed it over to the Income Tax department.

The Union Territory will have 930 polling stations for the May 16 Assembly elections. Of these 140 polling stations have been identified as sensitive.

The administration has sought deployment of paramilitary forces in these polling booths, Mr. Candavelou said.

The Elections department has identified differently-abled persons in each polling station. Wheelchairs would be provided to these stations for their convenience. Volunteers would also be deputed to these polling stations to help differently-abled persons, he added.

Voters in the Union Territory have been asked to verify whether their names are in the voters list. If they are unable to locate it till April 19, they have been asked to submit applications to get them added.
title: Elections Dept. launches grievance redressal system
